item.title: Big Pokemon Legends: Z-A Question Will Be Answered Later This Year
item.description:
Highlights

  • According to a reputable leaker, Pokemon Legends: Z-A's starters will be revealed later this year.
  • The current theory points to Snivy, Torchic, and Piplup as the Pokemon Legends: Z-A starters.

If a reputable Pokemon leaker is to be believed, fans will know what the Pokemon Legends: Z-A starters are by the end of the year. Pokemon Legends: Z-A was announced with a brief trailer that confirmed the game's Lumiose City setting, its 2025 Switch release window, and little else. There are still many unanswered questions about the game, but more information should come to light in the months leading up to its eventual Switch launch.

As a follow-up to Pokemon Legends: Arceus , the expectation is that Pokemon Legends: Z-A will handle starter Pokemon similarly to its predecessor. This means that it's likely fans can expect three starter Pokemon from past Pokemon games to be recycled in Legends: Z-A , though with the possibility that they will have alternate final forms with different looks and typing. Fans won't know for sure until the Pokemon Legends: Z-A starters are revealed to the public, and luckily, that is apparently happening later this year.

Related
Pokemon Legends: Z-A Must Make Good on a Missed Mega Evolution Opportunity

Mega Evolution fell by the wayside shortly after its premiere, so Pokemon Legends: Z-A should finally use it in obvious ways it never was.

Reliable Pokemon leaker Riddler_Khu recently took to Twitter to tease upcoming Pokemon projects . They were asked for news on the Pokemon Legends: Z-A starters, and responded that they will be revealed "within this year." Riddler_Khu did not provide any hints as to what the game's starter Pokemon will be, but fans already have their theories.

The current theory is that the Pokemon Legends: Z-A starters will be Snivy, Torchic, and Piplup. This theory was put together because their evolutions can all be tied to France , which is the country Lumiose City's Kalos region is based on. Not only that, but the Pokemon Legends: Arceus starters were recently paired up with Snivy, Torchic, and Piplup in a Pokemon Scarlet and Violet DLC trailer, which fans have taken as another hint for the Legends: Z-A starter lineup.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Starter Predictions

  • Snivy
  • Torchic
  • Piplup

The good news is that if Riddler_Khu is right about the Pokemon Legends: Z-A starters being revealed this year, fans will have their questions answered within the next six months or so. It's possible that Pokemon Legends: Z-A will be featured at the Nintendo Direct in June , though that event is said to be primarily focused on Switch games coming in the second half of 2024. It's also possible that another Pokemon Presents will be held at some point this year, which would provide the perfect opportunity to reveal the Pokemon Legends: Z-A starters. Whenever the starters are revealed, it will be interesting to see if the theories about them were correct or not.

item.title: Pokemon GO Announces New May 2024 Event
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon GO announces its newest Incense Day event set to run on May 26, encouraging players to catch Pokemon using the in-game Incense.
  • May's Incense Day will feature Ferroseed as its spotlight Pokemon, with increased spawn for the Grass-Steel Pokemon and its shiny variant.
  • Players will also see increased spawns for Pokemon sharing a type with Ferroseed, with increased Grass and Steel Pokemon appearances in hourlong bursts.

Pokemon GO has announced the next event coming to the massively popular monster-catching mobile game, putting the focus on Incense and a fifth-generation Pokemon. The mobile game features a wide variety of different events incentivizing players to pick up new Pokemon, often putting the spotlight on specific creatures. Pokemon GO 's monthly Community Day events offer increased spawn rates for certain Pokemon and their shiny variants, with the May 2024 Community Day recently confirmed to include Bounsweet. Now, another Grass-type Pokemon will star in one of the game's newest events.

Incense serves as one of the most useful resources for Pokemon GO players looking to build up their collection of in-game creatures. Incense functions similarly to Lures by increasing the spawn rates of Pokemon surrounding the player, with Incense following along with the player as they travel. Pokemon GO also offers a "Daily Adventure Incense," giving players a once-per-day 15-minute session of increased Spawns with some exclusive Pokemon like the Galarian variants of Kanto's legendary Birds available. Now, Incense is the focus of the next Pokemon GO event.

Related
Lucky Pokemon GO Player Gets Second Chance to Catch Rare Legendary Pokemon

A Pokemon GO player gets an incredibly lucky break when the Legendary Pokemon they encountered returns and gives them a second chance.

Pokemon GO recently announced its May 2024 Incense Day event through its official social media channels, with the event putting the focus on Ferroseed. During the event, players using Incense will see increased spawn rates for Ferroseed and its shiny version, with the event also doubling the time limit for Pokemon GO 's Daily Adventure Incense . The event will also feature a special Field Research for players to complete, offering exclusive rewards for catching Ferroseed and other Pokemon during the event. Incense Day: Ferroseed is scheduled to run on May 26 from 11:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. local time.

Pokemon GO Announces Ferroseed Incense Day Event

Date and Time

  • May 26, 11:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. local time

Event Bonuses

  • Incense is more likely to attract Ferroseed
  • Increased chance to encounter Shiny Ferroseed
  • Daily Adventure Incense lasts twice as long

Incense Encounters: Grass

  • 11:00 A.M. to 12:00 P.M., 1:00 P.M. to 2:00 P.M., 3:00 P.M. to 4:00 P.M.
  • Increased Incense spawns for Hisuian Voltorb, Tangela, Hoppip, Petilil, Phantump, and Morelull

Incense Encounters: Steel

  • 12:00 P.M. to 1:00 P.M., 2:00 P.M. to 3:00 P.M., 4:00 P.M. to 5:00 P.M.
  • Increased Incense spawns for Galarian Meowth, Magnemite, Aron, Beldum, Shieldon, and Togedemaru

Field Research

  • Special Field Research Tasks will be available with Stardust, Pinap Berries, Great Balls, and Ultra Balls as rewards.

Alongside Ferroseed, the Incense Day will offer higher spawn rates for several Pokemon sharing a Type with the Thorn Seed Pokemon. Grass Pokemon will be featured in three one-hour-long bursts during the event, with Pokemon like Hisuian Voltorb, Tangela, and Hoppip available among others. The increased Grass spawns will change off with higher Steel Pokemon spawns after each hour, featuring Pokemon like Galarian Meowth, Magnemite, and Aron. The previously-mentioned Field Research will grant rewards like Stardust, Pinap Berries, and Great and Ultra Balls.

Pokemon GO 's newest event follows massive sweeping updates to the game throughout recent months. The game's "#RediscoverGO" campaign has brought several changes to Pokemon GO , including updated biomes and enhancements to the game's AR systems. Not all of the new content has been popular, however, with the avatar system overhaul standing as one of Pokemon GO 's most controversial changes . Incense Day will give players plenty of chances to add some new Pokemon, and potentially new shinies, to their collection.

item.title: Four Gamers are Still Online on Wii U Servers Nearly 40 Days After Shutting Down
item.description:
Highlights

  • Four players defy Nintendo by staying online on Wii U and 3DS servers.
  • Lcd101 plans to stay online in Splatoon despite error codes, uncertain how long they can last.
  • It's the end of an era for Nintendo online services on Wii U and 3DS, but fans can still enjoy Wii U Switch ports.

Despite Nintendo “permanently” shutting down its Wii U and 3DS servers, four players remain online on the Nintendo Network 40 days later. By collectively staying online on the Wii U and 3DS servers, the players have beaten a record famously set by Halo 2 fans over a decade ago.

The Nintendo Network server shutdown was made known to players last year. One of the games affected by this shutdown is Splatoon , a colorful third-person shooter which was originally launched in 2015 on the Wii U.

Related
Splatoon 3 Reveals May 2024 Splatfest Details

Splatoon 3 revealed the date and time for its upcoming monthly Splatfest along with a notably darker prompt that has fans talking.

As reported on GamesRadar+ , there are still players online despite Nintendo’s decision to permanently shut down Wii U and 3DS online servers. Four players have been able to stay online on either the Wii U or 3DS servers . According to GaffsNotLaffs, Lcd101 is still enjoying online functionality on Splatoon . Fishguy6564 is on Mario Kart 7 . Another player, SlitherySheep, is on Super Mario Maker , and Omoroid is on Xenoblade Chronicles X . The nearly 40 days that the group has managed to stay online has surpassed a record previously set by Halo 2 fans who were able to stay connected to the servers for just over 25 days after the Xbox Live shut down.

Four Gamers Still Online Nearly 40 Days After Wii U Servers Shutdown

Previously, GaffsNotLaffs had tracked the number of players still online on Wii U and 3DS servers at 10 before that figure went down to the current four. This shutdown took effect in April of this year . Lcd101 plans on staying online in Splatoon . In a recent update, the player stated, "I am still online, but the lobby gives me the error code for maintenance, 106-0811. I intend to stay online in this state for as long as possible.” It is unclear how long he and the other three players will be able to stay online.

For fans of Nintendo’s online services on the Wii U and 3DS , this is the end of an era. However, they can still enjoy the online functionality of Wii U titles that were ported to the Nintendo Switch.

item.title: Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero Gets Exciting Update
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fans eagerly await the release of Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero, a return to the classic Budokai Tenkaichi series.
  • Ratings for the game indicate a potential 2024 release, with the game featuring fighters from Dragon Ball, Z, and Super.
  • Speculation points to a possible release date in late 2024.

A recent update made by Bandai Namco has suggested that the upcoming Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero will launch sometime this year. Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero has been one of the fandom's most greatly anticipated titles, as it is a return to the classic Budokai Tenkaichi series after a long absence. Players get the chance to control some of their favorite Dragon Ball characters, with this iteration of the game featuring fighters from across the original Dragon Ball , Z , and Super . While Bandai Namco hasn't given an official release date yet, ratings for the game suggest it could be soon.

Video games being given a rating is usually a good indication of where they are in development. Rating boards like the ESRB usually give them out when developers submit them to be reviewed, with them typically being "content complete" at that stage. Now Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero has gotten another rating that suggests a 2024 release for the game.

Related
Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero Confirms More Characters, Team Battles, and Fusion Mechanic

New Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero information reveals more of the game's roster, team battles, and how the fusion mechanic will work.

According to the IMDA (Infocomm Media Development Authority), the official entertainment rating body of Singapore, Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero got the approved rating for release on the PS5. Attached to this registration, however, is the game's year of release, stating it to be 2024. Considering how Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero also got an ESRB rating this past March, it appears the game will be released this year instead of being pushed to 2025.

Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero's Potential 2024 Window

Based on this update, any predictions of a release date for Sparking Zero seem to be more certain within 2024 now. Past leaks of Sparking Zero suggested that the game would be released in 2024 and the game would be hitting a spring or summer launch. Other more likely release windows, based on the releases of past Dragon Ball games, like Xenoverse 2 , also suggest it could be in late-2024 or early-2025. Fans will need to wait until Bandai Namco releases more official information about Sparking Zero 's release for now.

Besides the release date, the other thing fans have been speculating about is Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero 's potential roster . The game already has fan favorite characters like Goku, Vegeta, and Piccolo, alongside more obscure but beloved picks like Bergamo and Kakunsa from the Dragon Ball Super anime. Sparking Zero has also confirmed other returning mechanics like fusion, with characters like Kefla and Gotenks being a part of the game's roster as well.

item.title: Some Switch Online Subscribers Have an Extra Game Boy Game to Play
item.description:
Highlights

  • Switch Online in Japan added an extra game in the latest update.
  • Kaeru no Tame ni Kane wa Naru was added alongside Alleyway, Baseball, and Super Mario Land.

Nintendo Switch Online subscribers in Japan were treated to an extra game in the latest update in the form of Kaeru no Tame ni Kane wa Naru . One of the main selling points of the Nintendo Switch Online subscription service is access to retro Nintendo games from multiple platforms.

While Switch owners will want to be signed up for the service's Expansion Pack tier to get the most bang for their buck, the base Switch Online membership gives players a lot of classic games to play. Represented platforms include the NES, SNES, and the original Game Boy, the latter of which just had its library refreshed in a recent update. The recent Switch Online Game Boy update added Alleyway , Baseball , and Super Mario Land to the mix for subscribers worldwide, while those in Japan were treated to those games in addition to a surprise bonus.

Related
Nintendo Releases New Switch Online App Update

Nintendo releases a new Nintendo Switch Online app update, including a new display feature and various fixes for Android and iPhone users.

Switch Online subscribers in Japan can now play Kaeru no Tame ni Kane wa Naru on top of all the other Game Boy games that are currently available on the service. Kaeru no Tame ni Kane wa Naru translates to The Frog For Whom the Bell Tolls , an action-RPG from 1992 that was developed by Nintendo and Intelligent Systems. Only ever released in Japan, Kaeru no Tame ni Kane wa Naru was well-received at the time of its release and is considered one of the Game Boy's hidden gems . While the game never received an official localization from Nintendo, a fan translation does exist.

Nintendo Switch Online Game Boy Games List

  • Gargoyle's Quest - February 8, 2023
  • Kirby's Dream Land - February 8
  • Metroid 2: Return of Samus - February 8
  • Super Mario Land 2: 6 Golden Coines - February 8
  • Tetris - February 8
  • Yakuman (Japan Only) - February 8
  • Alone in the Dark: The New Nightmare - February 8, 2023
  • Game & Watch Gallery 3 - February 8, 2023
  • The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening DX - February 8, 2023
  • Wario Land 3 - February 8, 2023
  • BurgerTime Deluxe - March 15, 2023
  • Kirby's Dream Land 2 - March 15, 2023
  • Blaster Master: Enemy Below - June 5, 2023
  • Kirby Tilt 'n' Tumble - June 5, 2023
  • The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Ages - June 27, 2023
  • The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Seasons - June 27, 2023
  • Pokemon Trading Card Game - August 8, 2023
  • Quest for Camelot - September 6, 2023
  • Castlevania Legends - October 31, 2023
  • Dr. Mario - March 12, 2024
  • Mario Golf - March 12, 2024
  • Mario Tennis - March 12, 2024
  • Alleyway - May 15, 2024
  • Baseball - May 15, 2024
  • Kaeru no Tame ni Kane wa Naru (Japan Only) - May 15, 2024
  • Super Mario Land - May 15, 2024

Even without Kaeru no Tame ni Kane wa Naru , the latest Nintendo Switch Online update should please fans of the original Game Boy. It finally added the Game Boy launch title Super Mario Land , giving fans the chance to experience Mario's original handheld adventure. Super Mario Land is notable for being quite different from basically every other 2D Mario game out there with its inclusion of vehicles and shooting sections. In any case, the addition of Super Mario Land to the Switch Online lineup is another step toward the home console/handheld hybrid becoming the ultimate Mario gaming machine.

Now that Super Mario Land is part of Switch Online, there are only three 2D Super Mario games that aren't playable on the Switch . Switch owners are still missing out on New Super Mario Bros. New Super Mario Bros. 2 , and New Super Mario Bros. Wii , but there's always a chance they could be released for the console at some point down the road.
